title: Dynkin system
summary: A Dynkin system,[1] named after Eugene Dynkin is a collection of subsets of another universal set Ω {\displaystyle \Omega } satisfying a set of axioms weaker than those of 𝜎-algebra.  Dynkin systems are sometimes referred to as 𝜆-systems (Dynkin himself used this term) or d-system.[2] These set families have applications in measure theory and probability.
